title: Dylan Hartley back to his best after Lions omission
title_page: Dylan Hartley back to his best after Lions omission | Daily Mail Online
text:
Dylan Hartley is back to prime form and fitness after a stop-start season and will be ready to answer an emergency call from the Lions, according to his director of rugby at Northampton, Jim Mallinder.
The omission of the England captain from the British and Irish squad to tour New Zealand was one of the most contentious decisions made by head coach Warren Gatland and his assistants.
Hartley was left out, with his Test under-study, Saracens hooker Jamie George, making the cut along with Ken Owens of Wales and Ireland skipper Rory Best.
Dylan Hartley is back to his best form, says Northampton director of rugby Jim Mallinder
Mallinder (pictured) said Hartley was disappointed with Lions decision but has responded well
Instead of joining the crusade to the land of his birth, Hartley will lead a new-look England squad to Argentina, but Mallinder believes he could still make an impact with the Lions via a late call-up.
‘Dylan did everything he could,’ he told Sportsmail yesterday. ‘He missed some time this season because of suspension and injury, so he wasn’t able to play at his very best, but he came back for the Six Nations and he has worked so hard on his fitness.
‘In training, his results and numbers are now up there with all the forwards, so he’s got himself really fit and I think he’s playing well.
'His form has been getting better and against Saracens (in Saints’ last game, on April 16), that was the best game he’s had for us this season.
After a stop-start season, he won the Six Nations with England and had a stellar campaign
And the England No 2 is now determined to 'produce a big finale' for Northampton this season
‘So he is disappointed, but he’s had plenty of ups and downs in the past – and he did half expect this. He is determined to enjoy his time out in Argentina, continue to captain England well, as he has been doing, then if there is a chance for him – if an injury occurs – he will be ready to go out there (to New Zealand).
‘There will be injuries and call-ups. I went on one tour with England and on that I saw a number of call-ups, going to the Lions.
'That will happen again this year. Because Dylan missed a bit of time earlier in the season, he’s not desperate for the season to end. He’s looking forward to the matches to come and he wants to produce a big finale.’
Jamie George, Hartley's understudy for his country, was selected ahead of the England skipper
Ireland captain Rory Best and Wales hooker Ken Owens were also preferred by Gatland
